wikipedia_page.main: Charles Heslop (8 June 1883 in Thames Ditton, England – 13 April 1966) was a British actor.His stage successes include a musical version of Tons of Money, which toured Australia for Hugh J. Ward in 1924, co-starring Dot Brunton.He starred in the BBC television comedy Percy Ponsonby as a talkative barber. The series was broadcast in 1939, and was cancelled with the outbreak of the Second World War.In 1954 he appeared in William Douglas Home's The Manor of Northstead in the West End.
